No, I didn’t read those scriptures to comfort them. I read them to comfort me. I read them because I did not want to hate God for taking away my Christopher...

How about some sugar? Voletta stares at him, then snatches her hand away. She grabs a bowl of sugar and slams it on the table. Voletta sits back down on the couch as Selwyn sweetens his tea. INT. CHRISTOPHER’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Christopher uses Scotch tape to hang the tattered picture Love Bug Starski. Through the closed door, he hears the MUFFLED CONVERSATION of his parents.
Things are complicated, Voletta. I know you don’t want to hear that but that’s the truth.
Things are complicated for me, too. That doesn’t mean I'm going to abandon our son for five years. Christopher goes to his boom box, turns on the radio, mov the dial to 107.5, Mr. Magic’s Rap Attack.

It wasn’t till after I was pregnant that he admitted to being married. He wasn’t man enough to accept his responsibility. So I vowed to become Christopher’s mother and father. Voletta closes the door after Selwyn. She stands angry as she wipes tears from her eyes.

What up, yo. Then his hand swallows up Andre's.

Since I was a little shorty.

Right now?

The legendary Soul Food tourist trap in the heart of Harl Biggie, Mister Cee, Puffy and Uptown intern MARK PITTS, s at a corner table. Puffy looks at Biggie, takes in the whole thug package.

“Look up_in the sky, it’s a bird, it’s a plane. Nope, it’s Mary J., ain't _a damn thing changed. Kickin’ ill flava, with the Teflon Don. Record shop, getting props. She got it goin’ on...” Biggie finishes his verse and comes out of the booth. No says a word to him. Then --

Tests for what?

They have to act aggressively if I'm going to have a chance.

Come here. Biggie can’t move. Voletta walks to him, gently turns him around.

So?
Socks.

On my life, your shit is gangsta, partner.

Why does a TV reporter stand in a war zone with bombs going off and shit? We hold a mirror up to society. Don’t ask me why we do it. I just know that’s what the fuck we do. Then Tupac glances at the Hot Lady.

Besides. How else can a nigga shine? Tupac gets up and whispers to the Lady. They head to the back room together. Biggie sits back checking out the whole crazy scene. Wome glance at him flirtatiously and GUYS look at him with env He picks up the telephone on the end table and dials.

Alright. I love -- But Biggie has already hung up.  50.

Few... Few, it’s me. Can you open the door? C’mon. I want to talk to you. Please.  91. Faith unchains the door. Biggie walks in and she slaps th shit out of him.
You made me feel dirty and cheap and scared to fucking death, Big. How fucking dare you! Faith turns away shedding angry tears. Biggie notices her suitcases and boxes.
Can you listen to me a minute?
It's over. It was over a long time ago. I just didn’t have the courage to admit it.
I’m sorry about bugging the fuck out the way I did. Sorry about a lot of shit. I reached some kind of breaking point and shit.
That makes two of us. (then) Why didn’t you just look me in the eyes and ask me?
Okay. So I’m asking. What happened with you and Pac?
I saw him at the House of Blues. We took a picture. End of story. (then) Okay? Biggie nods.
End of story.
At least, now you have an idea of what it feels like to be cheated on. Faith starts packing again.  92.
I don’t wanna let you go.
You want to end up in the same fucked up place? ‘Cause sooner or later that will happen. You know that. Biggie comes from behind her, gently kisses her neck. She starts to give in and faces him.
This doesn’t change things. They kiss and sink to the floor...
After Big and Faith split up, he bought himself a spot in Jersey.

The Soul Train Awards. There’s a red carpet outside lined with FANS standing behind metal gates. A ROW OF PAPARAZZI constantly FLASHING at something and a phalanx of BLACK a WHITE LIMOS.  93.
Things were going so well, I started to think the only ones who could stop us were ourselves.

What size are these?

Always fuckin’ problems!

They sent over the wrong size shoes. He’s not going on.
What? Now ain‘t the time for a damn temper tantrum.

Give us a minute. Big Sexy steps away.

You know how it goes.
We ain’t got time for this shit.
Puffy goes in the dressing room and sees Biggie sitting i the corner. Big Sexy, Puffy’s bodyguard, trails behind.
You want me to cry? Is that what it’s gonna take? Then I'll cry. Big, don't do this to me. Don’t do this to you.
I don’t go on if the shoes ain't right. Damien comes in.
The Big and Tall shop don’t have it either. Big Sexy looks down at Biggie’s shoes.
What size you wear? MUSIC UP: THE NOTORIOUS B.I.G.'S “ONE MORE CHANCE.”  95.
CLOSE on Biggie’s shoes. They’re a little shabby but they fit.
Biggie in his tux, rocking with the mic in his hand.

First thing first, I poppa freaks all the 2) D ies. Playbo bunnies. Those getting nothing... On stage right, with TUXEDOED DANCERS in back, Puffy stan out in a white tux. Also on stage is Faith, with the slightest pouch starting to show.

Tupac, Suge and a FEW DEATH ROW ENTOURAGE MEMBERS linger. Biggie is too busy rocking to notice Tupac and his friend stand up in the middle of the performance, and walk out.
Biggie, Cease and Damien make their way out to where the valet stand is. A RED HUMMER pulls up. The back window rolls down. It’s Tupac. He yells directly at Biggie.

Outlawz, motherfucka! Biggie just stares at Tupac. There’s a wildness in Tupac’ eyes that can only be described as blood. Suge gets out o the car and starts walking forward. Without words, Damien pulls out his nine. Cease starts yelling at Tupac. A SWAR OF FRUIT OF ISLAM SECURITY GUARDS separate the two camps. The Hummer pulls off. Biggie stands there in disbelief.
That was some theatrical shit. He really thinks he’s Bishop from “Juice.”  96.
You say the word, we put an end to all this shit. Permanently. Biggie shakes his head.
We're not gonna play into it.
The voice of radio personality, WENDY WILLIAMS, is heard.

I know everybody’s on the edge of their seat to hear the latest drama from Bad Boy Records and Death Row Records. Scandalous! Last week it was guns and shouts at the Soul Train Awards. Now we have the most scandalous news of all -- Faith is pregnant. But there's only one problem. Who’s the daddy?
Biggie stands tall on stage. HALF THE CROWD cheers. The OTHER HALF OF THE CROWD boos. Biggie takes this in, glanc at Damien and Cease standing off stage. He turns back to crowd.
Yo! Yo, check it out! The CROWD QUIETS DOWN.

I had this friend, know what I’m sayin’. Me and duke were real cool. At least, I thought we were. But that’s the thing about this business. Jealousy and envy will get you twisted, it will turn your best friend into your worst enemy. He warned me, but I didn’t believe him. FROM BEHIND HIS TURNTABLE -- D.J. ENUFF smiles and cues u the beat.  97.

This song was made months before anything happened to Tupac. It was supposed to be on Mary J. Blige’s album, but Uptown Records thought the shit was too hardcore. But he won't believe me. Maybe nobody will. But frankly, at this point, I don’t give a fuck. So Pac, this goes out to you. D.J. Enuff lets the beat go. The crowd goes CRAZY. Biggie nods his head to the heavy bass and piano line. Backstage, Cease grabs a mic and runs on stage. Puffy sta backstage, head bobbing.
Get high motherfuckas! Ready to die, motherfuckas!

Biggie kept his mouth shut for a long ass time. He decided not to strike back physically. But on this night at least, he verbally threw an uppercut. Maybe it wasn't the most Christian thing to do, but I think it was something all of us who were down with Big needed.

“Who shot ya? Separate the weak from the obsolete. Hard to creep them Brooklyn streets. It’s on nigga. Fuck all that bickering beef...” The crowd literally jumps up and down. The energy is energetic. Biggie raps so hard, he sweats through his clothes. It’s a public battle and declaration. He’s not scared of Tupac. And he’s not going away quietly.
“Slip and break the eleventh commandment. Thou shalt not fuck with raw C-Poppa. Feel a thousand deaths when I drop ya...” The East Coast crowd is cheering Biggie on.  98.

If this East Coast/West Coast beef was about to become a war, on this night, Biggie became general and thousands of soldiers enlisted. Biggie looks down at the front row when he notices a tall thin WOMAN with striking eyes. She smiles at him as she grooves to the beat.
Biggie talks to the striking woman. Her name is TIFFANY L A.K.A CHARLI BALTIMORE. She pulls out a disposable camera
Let me take your picture. Biggie smiles and takes the camera from her.
Nah. Let me take yours. FLASH.

Big met Tiffany Lane a.k.a Charli Baltimore. She would help keep his mind off the stress. And become the next rapper he would discover. A FLASH OF BIGGIE AND CHARLI PERFORMING IN THE “GET MONEY VIDEO GOES ACROSS FRAME.
Ain’t no way to describe the effect Big had on women. He was either driving them crazy in a good way, driving them crazy in a bad way, but he was always driving them crazy.

Faith, now seven months pregnant, is driving. The radio i turned to Hot 97. Lil Kim’s song “Queen Bee” is on. Faith grooves to it despite herself. But then Faith gets deeper into the REMIX VERSE with the cuss words bleeped out.  99.

{through the radio) “Let _me stress. The tatoo on your breast. Big. You're rockin’ my_ property. PYP. Play your position. Know I got ya wishin’. You never started dissin’. Plus I iv d_better than you. pussy gets wetter than you. I fuck much better than you. I dedicate this song to ya ass like R. Kelly. And_ that twin Pac up in your belly.” Suddenly, Faith does a full U-turn.

Kim sits with Puffy and another PRODUCER, going over some lyrics. The door opens and Kim barely has time to blink w Faith rains down punches on her. Puffy pulls her away. Faith’s hair is messed up, she has lost an earring, but h smile says it all.
Biggie and Cease watch Pay-Per-View, where Mike Tyson bea up on Bruce Seldon. The CAMERA catches Tupac and Suge sitting ring-side.
There goes your boy.
Yeah, right.
Biggie is on the toilet. He reads VIBE'’s, Juice Issue. H and Puffy are on the cover. CLOSE ON the headlines. It reads, “East Versus West.” Then --
Oh shit!  100.
Biggie walks back to the den and finds the TV reporting o the shooting of Tupac.

Once again, rapper and actor, Tupac Shakur has been rushed to University Medical Center in critical condition after being gunned down and suffering multiple gunshot wounds. This coming just hours after attending the Mike Tyson and Bruce Seldon heavyweight boxing match... CRIME SCENE PHOTOS OF THE SHOOTING FLASH ACROSS FRAME. Biggie is stunned. Suddenly, his cell phone rings. Cease’ cell phone rings. Biggie’s home phone rings.
(on his cell) Yeah, we watching the shit right NOW. . Cease turns to see Biggie answer the phone.
Yo, I was like twelve, thirteen- fucking-years-old when I first started seeing Big Chris on the corner. He was the closest thing I ever had to a role model.
Cease gets into one of the limos.
He eventually let me hang with him on the corner. But he didn’t want me hustling. He said the drug game was too dirty for my hands to touch.
Cease, distraught, looks out the window as Damien sits do next to him.  101.
Six days after Pac got shot in Vegas, he died. A NEWS REPORT OF TUPAC’S DEATH FLASHES ACROSS SCREEN.

Given the circumstances, Chris coulda’ been celebrating. I told him, at least we don’t have to worry about him any more. He said that was a fucked up way to look at it. But the thing is, the rap game was becoming more ruthless than the crack game...
Biggie talks on the phone with Voletta.
I saw his mother on TV. She’s a strong woman but I feel so bad for her. You planning to go to his funeral?
Wouldn't be a good idea.
Well, I'm going to say a prayer for his mother. Such a senseless waste,
Tupac's voice, loud and clear.

We just here celebrating Biggie Smalls’ signing a deal with Bad Boy Records... Biggie is watching the VIDEO of him and Tupac, as they sa side-by-side FREESTYLING in the nightclub. Biggie smokes blunt. This is his memorial service for Pac.  102.
Cease sits behind the wheel of the parked truck and Charl Baltimore sits in the back. They are waiting on Biggie who is outside of a pizza stor
Why does he like to be with so many different women?
If you're asking if he cares about you, I think the answer is yes. If you're asking if you’re the only one, you gotta talk to him.
That wasn’t the question.
You want your answer. Look at Big. Through the SUV window they see Biggie sign an autograph bite into his pizza.
He's got a big appetite.

It wasn’t till she accepted my answer that I realized why so many sisters put up with bullshit. It ain’t ‘cause they don’t want better. It’s ‘cause they think brothers can‘t do no better. Biggie gets back in the SUV, kissing on Charli’s neck. Th Cease tries to start the truck. It won’t move.
What are we waiting for? Cease keeps TURNING THE KEY but THE TRUCK MAKES WEIRD NOI
A SERVICEMAN comes out.  103.
We have a loaner that you can use. Free of charge.
Biggie, Cease and Tiffany look at the beat-up Dodge Astro
Let’s get home before we get caught riding in this piece of shit.
It’s RAINING cats and dogs. The van slides all over the road.
Slow down, man.
I’m trying. These fuckin’ brakes keep locking up. Cease looks up and sees the OFF RAMP. He guns the wheel right. THE ASTROVAN SLIDES.
The Astrovan CRASHES. THE VAN SLAMS THE GUARD RAIL AND VE INTO THE ROAD ON THE OTHER SIDE. A sickening crunch as it lands.

Cease is leaned back against the front seat, blood pourin from his mouth. Charli is unconscious, her head pressed u against the cracked bloody windshield. Biggie is trapped between the seat and the dashboard, dazed and fighting consciousness.
SEVERAL MINUTES LATER an ambulance is parked nearby as FI FIGHTERS cut open the upside down vehicle with HYDRAULIC SPREADER-CUTTERS.  104.
Biggie lays in a hospital bed, his leg elevated in tracti Puffy, Mark and Wayne talk to him from around the room, b their VOICES GO IN AND OUT in his painkiller haze.
The doctor says you'll walk again. It’s just gonna take some time, alright?
Shit, be happy it’s just your leg. Cease lost the whole top row of his teeth and Tiffany's forehead is fucked up.
I had a dream that Tupac got killed. The three guys exchange looks.
Wasn’t a dream, Big. That really happened. (then) Big? Biggie starts to drift off.

Biggie lays alone in the room watching MTV on the overhea TV. KURT LODER reports on his accident. But his name is n longer just his name. It has taken on the burden of Tupac shooting, of the East Coast/West Coast feud, of all that wrong with hip hop. As the verbal assault continues from TV, Biggie grows agitated, helplessness fueling fury. Suddenly, he snatches the TV remote and hurls it at the television. The remote shatters into pieces and drops harmlessly to the floor as the report continues...
The room is quiet. Biggie lays still in the bed, staring at the ceiling, with nothing but his tortured thoughts. The door pushes open.  105.
Good morning. No response from Biggie.

Gotta admit, I never heard of you. My daughter told me who you are. I’m a blues man myself. Now if you were B.B. King, I'd of had your autograph by now. Biggie finally turns, sees the orderly, JEFF, a tall midd aged man with a West Indian accent.
You remind me of my father.
I’m honored.
That’s not a compliment. I haven’t thought about him in years.
In years? That doesn’t sound right.
Not everything is right. If it was, I wouldn't be here. (beat, then --) What did your daughter tell you about me? Jeff changes Biggie’s I.v.
She said you're the greatest rapper of all time. And that you spit it like you live it. (smiles) Whatever that means. Biggie turns away.
It's funny. When you’re on your feet, you only look ahead. But when you're on your back, you spend your time staring at the ceiling. (MORE )
Looking for God. Can‘’t get more right than that.
Do me a favor? Get the fuck out of here. Jeff, rattled, walks out. Biggie lets out a frustrated si then slowly turns his head to the ceiling.
Biggie is in a wheelchair. T‘yanna, now four-years-old, s on her dad‘s lap and Jan stands behind them.
Okay. Five, four, three, two, one. Jan pushes them as fast as she can, the wheelchair becomi rocket ship. T’yanna cracks up as if this is a ride at an amusement park...
Biggie teaches T’yanna “The Breaks.” Jan stands in the hallway watching.
(rapping) Clap your hands everybody...
(rapping) Clap your hands everybody...
If you got what it takes... T’ YANNA If you got what it takes...
‘Cause I’m Kurtis Blow...
‘Cause I’m Kurtis Blow...
And I want you to know... T’YANNA And I want you to know...  107.
That these are the breaks... T’YANNA That these are the breaks...
Break it up, break it up, break it up! T’YANNA Break it up, break it up, break it up! Biggie cracks up. And from the hallway, so does Jan.
Biggie has fallen asleep in front of the TV and T’yanna sleeps on his chest. Jan stares at the two of them, wishing she could freeze t Moment. She picks T’yanna up and carries her to bed.
Biggie starts to wake up as Jan walks back into the room.
Damn. What time is it?
Almost nine-thirty.
Shit. If I was in the studio I could go to the crack of dawn. But that little girl wore me out. Jan laughs.
Try doing that seven days a week. An awkward pause.
I didn’t mean it like that.
Okay if you did.  108.
You mind if we crash for the night? I'd hate to move her right now.
Yeah, it’s all good. Jan picks up the Chinese food take-out boxes on the table starts to bring them to the kitchen.
Would it be messed up if I told you, I’m kind of glad you had that accident.
Yeah. That would be messed up.
I won’t say it then. Jan crosses to the kitchen.
Biggie, sitting in his wheelchair, wears a shower cap at bedside. Faith is SCREAMING IN PAIN.
Large, black hands hold a tiny, light-skinned BABY. Biggi in his wheelchair, rocks his son to sleep. Faith is fast asleep, exhausted from labor.
(whispering) Can I hold my grandson, now? Voletta reaches for the baby, but Biggie won’t give him u
(whispering) One more minute, Ma! Voletta chuckles.
Okay. Damien tips in, carrying flowers. Everyone continues to whisper.  109.
Hey, peoples.
Hi, Damien. I’m going to get some tea. When I come back you're going to have to pin down Christopher so I can hold the baby.
You know I got your back Miss Wallace. Voletta exits.
Say hello to your nephew. Damien studies him.
He‘s beautiful. Little nigga looks like a light-skinned you.
Damn. Can’t this motherfucka be in the world for one day before being called nigga? Damien laughs.
What?
I’m sorry. But is motherfucka really that better? Damien and Biggie laugh.
Biggie wheels himself on the patio, pulls out a pen and hospital stationary. Biggie writes, “Five Year Plan.” Then he begins to work i out.  110.
T'yanna is on the floor playing with dolls as Biggie talk with SOMEONE on the phone.
I'm kicking it with my daughter.
INT. KIM’S CAR - DAY She is talking to Biggie from her cell phone.
Okay. I’m on my way.
That ain’t a good idea.
Why not?
This is supposed to be our alone time.
So what the fuck, I gotta let you get me pregnant to see you now?
I‘1l call you later.
Don’t bother nigga. Fuck you.
Fuck you too, bitch. Biggie hangs up, turns to see T’yanna looking startled.
Biggie wheels himself in his chair as T’yanna sits on his lap.
My pops taught me only one thing, but I never forgot it. (MORE)
He told me to look at a man in the eyes when you shake his hand. Now, I’m gonna teach you something I never want you to forget. Okay? T’YANNA Okay.

You're daddy’s princess, Te Te. So no matter what, for any reason, never let a man disrespect you and call you a bitch. Got it? T’‘YANNA Yes, Daddy. Then Biggie does a few tricks with his wheelchair that ca her to laugh. INT. BIGGIE’S SUV - DAY Cease drives. Biggie is in the passenger seat. Chico and Damien are in the back. They drive through Bed-Stuy, thro the streets, sounds and people who shaped them all. Biggie looks out of the window seeing the corner he used hustle on, the alley where he beat up Lennox the drug use who ratted on him and the record store where he battled Ralston, the sucka M.C.
I talked to Mark today.
Yeah?
He’s worried about you. Wants me to convince you to go back into the studio. Cease chimes in.
It's been two years since “Ready to Die” came out.
So he talked to you, too? Cease, busted --  112.
Yeah.
So what did ya’ll tell him?

They should have told him you would get back into the studio when you’re good and fucking ready. ‘Cause no one could talk your hard- headed ass into anything anyway. They all laugh. Then as they pull up to a red light, SOMETHING OUTSIDE CATCHES BIGGIE’S ATTENTION.
Later for the studio. Big Chris is thinking about starting a clothing company. And a restaurant, right? Biggie nods but his attention is drawn elsewhere.

A restaurant would be hot. But I want to be the motherfucka who’s interviewing the waitresses. As the guys joke about the waitress qualifications -- The person who Biggie is staring at comes into frame. IT

text: She seems to have gotten herself together. She is dressed nice and even more amazing, she holds the hand of a FIVE- OLD BOY who looks just like her. Biggie is mesmerized and his heart is pounding...

With the use of a cane, Biggie walks to the dinner table. Crowded around the table are Biggie, Cease, Damien and Ch Miss Wallace places food on the table and sits with them. Voletta closes her eyes and bows her head. The guys look each other, taking the cue. They take off their caps and bow their heads. Biggie says the grace.
(heartfelt) Dear God... thank you.  113. Then Biggie looks up but everyone’s head remains bowed. Finally, Cease peeks, then Damien, then Chico.
That’s all? Chico starts to laugh.
Damn man. At least drop God is good, God is great. His boys start cracking the hell up. But Voletta gets it.
I think it was perfect. She starts eating and everyone else digs in as well.
Biggie picks up the phone and dials a number.
Yo Mark, I think I’m ready to get back to work...

“Hah, sicka than your average Poppa, twist cabbage off instinct, niggas don't think shit stink, pink gators, my Detroit players, Timb's for my hooligans in Brooklyn...” AS THE “HYPNOTIZE” TRACK PLAYS...
Biggie picks up his son C.J. from out of his crib and kis him on the cheek.
Daddy will see you in a few weeks. “HYPNOTIZE” CONTINUES AS THE HOLLYWOOD SIGN AND VARIOUS S OF CALIFORNIA COME INTO VIEW.
“Girl 1 us, wanna do u screw _u: us?
Yeah Poppa and Puff. Close like Starsky and Hutch...”

Puffy and Biggie splash through the water in a speedboat CAMERA CREW films them rapping to the “Hypnotize” track. This is not a “hood” video. It’s a mini-action movie. ASSAILANTS from black helicopters shoot at them and they trying to evade them as Biggie and Puffy wear designer clothes that may cost more than the entire budget of othe video shoots.

For most people, this video was hot. But for Chris, it symbolized his life. He evaded and survived so many fucking obstacles. Even though his father bailed on him, even though he made bad choices, he was no longer in jail, he was no longer on the corner slanging rock and he was not dead. Just like the video, when you thought you had him cornered, he slipped away.

Puffy and Biggie rap to the track as they stand in front cage where there is a black leopard. They are trying to g the scene right and hope that the leopard will cooperate. Suddenly, the leopard growls and Puffy jumps, startled. Biggie falls to the ground laughing his ass off. This is happiest we’ve seen him. The future is bright.

Biggie and Damien sit in a parlor on Sunset Boulevard as TATOO ARTISTS work on their forearms. They are getting th twenty-third psalm put into their flesh. “Yea, though I w through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil...” THE MUSIC TRAILS OFF as:
Voletta watches the Soul Train Awards and sees Biggie, al dressed up, walk out on stage.  115.
Biggie stands at the podium with Brian McKnight, musical group, 112, and Puffy.
And the Soul Train Music Award goes to... Biggie steps up and suddenly several BOOS RAIN DOWN FROM BALCONY.
What’s up, Cali? The boos ESCALATE...
Biggie is on the phone with Voletta.
You sure they were booing? I couldn’t tell.
They did some audio trick for the East Coast feed, made it sound like applause.
I don’t like you being out there.
I think me being out here is gonna put an end to all this nonsense. Voletta has a look of concern on her face, mother’s instinct --
I want you to be careful, Chrissy- Pooh.
I hate it when you call me that.  116.
I forgot. You’re all grown up now.
Biggie rides in the passenger seat. In the truck with him are Damien, Cease and a guy named, GREG, who is driving. Biggie talks on his cell.
Ya'll see how sexy I looked last night?
Jan laughs.
You’re sick, Chris. But yes, we saw you. You looked a’ight.
I may have to spend time out here promoting the album and shit. You think T’yanna can come out? My mom’s could maybe bring her. We could do the whole Disneyland thing. Jan smiles, elated.
I wouldn't have a problem with that.

A BLACK IMPALA SS sits on twenty-twos with white walls. T car is so lovingly polished, you can see your face in it. INT. FAITH’S HOTEL ROOM - NIGHT She rushes around getting dressed as her cell phone rings She picks it up.  117.
What.
Biggie is on the other end.
You coming to the party?
I'd be dressed by now if people would stop calling.
Well yo, when you get back to New York I want you to send C.J. out here with my mom’s.
Big, what are you talking about?
I’m gonna be out here for a while and I want my kids to be here.
Let me think about it, okay?
What’s there to think about?
Look, I can’t do this now. Annoyed, Faith hangs up. Biggie hangs up, pissed.

It is the VIBE party and the place is packed wall-to-wall Slowly, the crowd’s attention gets diverted to the front door. THE BAD BOY ENTOURAGE HAS ARRIVED. First it is Puffy, flanked by BODYGUARDS who enter. Then is Biggie with his boys Mark Pitts and D-Dot. And it’s as the whole East Coast - West Coast rivalry has instantly b washed away. They walk through the club as if they own th town -- and they do. Everyone looks at Biggie -- the wome the men, the celebrities, you name it.  118. And now as Biggie moves through the crowd receiving love, gets it. He doesn’t just represent Bed-Stuy. With all of his positive attributes and shortcomings as well, he represents Compton, Watts, Crenshaw, etc. RUSSELL SIMMONS gives Biggie a pat on the back. Andre Harrell raises a champagne glass to him. Biggie is their everyman. Their Manchild in the promised land. And he soa it all in...

The garage is immaculate. There is a WORKBENCH with a nin millimeter disassembled. A LIGHT-SKINNED BLACK MAN cleans and oils the weapon, taking great care with every single piece. WE DO NOT SEE HIS FACE. There are FOUR POLICE SCANNERS on the edge of the bench. Once the gun is cleaned, the man puts it in a blue duffle bag.
Puffy and Biggie sit with each other. THIS IS THE SCENE F THE START OF THE MOVIE.
You feel all this love we’re getting?
(nods, then --) I just wanna give it all back. Suddenly, “Hypnotize” PLAYS.
Looks like you just did. The crowd dances as if this was the first party of the re of their lives. They need this... they want it.
We did a hell of a lot in a short amount of time.
We ain’t done, kid. Puffy raises his glass of champagne.  119.
Let’s change the world. Biggie raises his glass.
Can't change the world if we don’t change ourselves. They clink glasses.
The tires on the Impala spin around as the car busts thro the night...
It moves through the L.A. streets. On the passenger seat the blue duffle bag and the police scanners are on the floor...
As the party is in full effect, Biggie glances over to another table and sees Faith. She notices Biggie looking angrily turns away.

There is a police barricade as one of the streets is bloc off. The black Impala drives up to the barricade and an OFFICER notices the LAPD placard on the dash. He lets the car go through. Simultaneously, Faith hops in a town car leaves.
ANOTHER SONG IS BEING PLAYED. And just as the party is in full swing, FIRE MARSHALS ENTER. The CHIEF heads to the D booth.
The Chief whispers a few words to the D.J. and THE MUSIC STOPS. People in the crowd groan.  120. D.J. Sorry everyone, but they’re saying it’s a fire hazard. We're getting shut down.
The angry crowd disperses.

Puffy stands with Big Sexy, another bodyguard named, KENN and TWO OTHER SECURITY GUYS. The VALET brings Puffy’s Suburban rental and he and his c hop in. Mark, D-Dot and a guy named, TRACEY LEE, hop into a WHITE LIMO. Biggie stands waiting with Damien, Cease and Greg. Biggie, talking on his cell --
How ‘bout when I get back, we sit down and figure out what the fuck we're doing?
